title: 113_hr4565
content: The "Startup Capital Modernization Act of 2014" increases small issues exemptive authority under the Securities Act of 1933 to $10,000,000 and includes preemption of state laws. The amendment to the Securities Act of 1933 clarifies State enforcement authority over registration requirements and does not limit State jurisdiction to take action against issuers or intermediaries using exemptions from registration. The amendment clarifies State enforcement authority over registration requirements and adds provisions for unlawful conduct in transactions under section 3(b). SEC. 4. EXCLUSION FROM SHAREHOLDER CAP. Section 12(g) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 is amended to exclude securities issued under Regulation A from certain provisions if the issuer meets specific requirements. The Securities and Exchange Commission is required to issue a rule to implement this amendment within 180 days. This exclusion applies to securities issued before, on, or after the enactment of this section. The exclusion under Section 12(g) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 for securities issued under Regulation A applies to securities issued before, on, or after the enactment of this Act. SEC. 5. EXEMPTED TRANSACTIONS. SEC. 5 of the Securities Act of 1933 amends Section 4 to include transactions meeting the requirements of subsection (d). These transactions involve accredited investors and require reasonable steps for verification if general solicitation is used. Section 230.506(c)(ii) of title 17, Code of Federal Regulations states that each purchaser must be an accredited investor. Securities sold under subsection (a)(7) are considered not involving a public offering. The exemption does not apply if the seller is an issuer, its subsidiaries or parent, an underwriter receiving compensation from the issuer, or a dealer. Transactions meeting these requirements are not considered distributions under section 2(a)(11). Additionally, Section 18(b)(4) of the Securities Act of 1933 is amended to include certain exempt offerings. In subsection (a)(7), a new subparagraph (G) is added as the end, referencing section 4(a)(7).
